    More on TTM Technologies (NASDAQ:TTMI): Q2 misses on both EPS and revenue estimates as sales...

    More on TTM Technologies (NASDAQ:TTMI): Q2 misses on both EPS and revenue estimates as sales miss the mark for the quarter. The company also guides its Q3 lower, now expecting to earn between $0.16 - $0.24 per share on revenues in the $340 - $360M range, less than consensus expectations of an EPS of $0.33 on revenue of $363M. Shares -10.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:24 PM
  • SIMG

    More on Silicon Image's Q2: The strong results were fueled by growing sales of the company's MHL...

    More on Silicon Image's Q2: The strong results were fueled by growing sales of the company's MHL video-transfer chips for mobile devices. Cumulative MHL shipments are now above 100M. $5.1M worth of shares repurchased during quarter. SIMG expects Q3 revenue of $73M-$75M, above a $70.3M consensus. SIMG +22.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:18 PM

  • ALL

    More on Allstate (NYSE:ALL): Q2 beats on all counts as its top improves on a decline in natural...

    More on Allstate (NYSE:ALL): Q2 beats on all counts as its top improves on a decline in natural disasters Y/Y and higher auto and home rates. Operating profit came in at $0.87 a share, exceeding consensus estimates. Net premiums written rose 3.8% to $6.86B, while its property-liability combined ratio - a measure of how much of its collected premiums were paid out as losses or expenses - improved to 98% from 123.3% in the prior year period. Shares +4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:10 PM

  • TRLG

    More on True Religion Apparel (NASDAQ:TRLG): Q2 beats on the bottom line but misses on its top...

    More on True Religion Apparel (NASDAQ:TRLG): Q2 beats on the bottom line but misses on its top line as revenue growth slowed from previous quarters. Net profit rose 3.6% as the jeans maker reported continued increases in direct consumer sales in the U.S., but the company cut FY12 earnings target to $1.80 - $1.86 per share, down from its previous target of $1.88 - $1.95. It also lowered the top end of revenue guidance by $5M, now seeing FY sales of $450M to $455M. Shares -13.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:50 PM

    SourceFire (NASDAQ:FIRE): Q2 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $50.6M (+39% Y/Y) beats by $1.7M. Expects Q3 revenue of $54M-$56M, in-line with $55.1M consensus. Expects Q3 EPS of $0.19-$0.21, below $0.22 consensus. Shares -4.4% AH. (PR)

    McGrath RentCorp (NASDAQ:MGRC): Q2 EPS of $0.42 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $83.8M (+5.4% Y/Y) misses by $3.07M. Shares -9.8% AH. (PR)

  • AMD

    Le Jiaming, AMD's China sales chief, has reportedly resigned as part of a broader shakeup of the...

    Le Jiaming, AMD's China sales chief, has reportedly resigned as part of a broader shakeup of the chipmaker's local ops. AMD partly blamed weak channel sales of desktop CPUs in China for its Q2 warning, and all signs indicate the company is losing share to Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) the market (among other places). AMD has seen a slew of executive departures lately.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM
  • CHEF

    Chefs' Warehouse (NASDAQ:CHEF): Q2 EPS of $0.23 in-line. Revenue of $114.8M (+15.7% Y/Y) misses...

  • DRIV-OLD

    Digital River (NASDAQ:DRIV-OLD): Q2 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $90.8M (-2% Y/Y)...

    Digital River (NASDAQ:DRIV-OLD): Q2 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $90.8M (-2% Y/Y) misses by $2.6M. Expects Q3 revenue of $88M-$91M and EPS of $0.12-$0.18, below consensus of $97.1M and $0.26. Expects 2012 revenue of $378M-$390M and EPS of $0.96-$1.08, below consensus of $405.9M and $1.22. Weak PC sales and macro issues blamed. New $100M stock buyback announced. Shares -12.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM

  • FTR

    More on Frontier's Q2: 5,400 broadband subs added. Net increase of 6,300 video subs (satellite...

    More on Frontier's Q2: 5,400 broadband subs added. Net increase of 6,300 video subs (satellite adds cancel out Verizon FiOS losses). Local/long distance revenue -9% Y/Y, data/Internet revenue -1%. Average revenue per residential and business subs both up slightly Q/Q. Access lines fell 8% Y/Y to 5.07M, headcount up by 402 to 15,332. $7.67B in long-term debt on balance sheet, another $617M due within one year. FTR +5.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • GNW

    More on Genworth (NYSE:GNW): NOI of $0.16/share vs. loss of $0.23 a year ago. Global mortgage...

    More on Genworth (NYSE:GNW): NOI of $0.16/share vs. loss of $0.23 a year ago. Global mortgage insurance operations NOI of $51M vs. loss of $36M in Q1, loss of $177M a year ago. Insurance and Wealth Management NOI of $79M, down from $81M in Q1 and $138M a year ago. Book value/share of $22.71 vs. $22.17 a year ago. Shares +4.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • ALL

    Allstate (NYSE:ALL): Q2 EPS of $0.86 beats by $0.29. Revenue of $8.28B (+% Y/Y) beats by $1.45B....

    Allstate (NYSE:ALL): Q2 EPS of $0.86 beats by $0.29. Revenue of $8.28B (+% Y/Y) beats by $1.45B. Shares +2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • APC

    “A lot of people” have approached Anadarko (APC -3.2%) about possibly buying a stake...

    “A lot of people” have approached Anadarko (APC -3.2%) about possibly buying a stake in gas assets off the coast of Mozambique, CEO Al Walker says, and "once we find the right deal... we’ll be inclined to pursue something." Also, the Tronox lawsuit has created an "unfortunate cloud" over the stock, he says, but more info may be available with the 10-Q filing on Aug. 9.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • SMSI

    Smith Micro (SMSI +2.4%) gains today after saying that on May 21, it was SMSI <font...

    Smith Micro (SMSI +2.4%) gains today after saying that on May 21, it was SMSI <font color="green">+2.4%</font>) gains today after saying that on May 21, it was granted a motion to dismiss the federal securities fraud class action that had been filed against it shortly after releasing its Q1 guidance. No payments were made to any plaintiffs in connection with any of these dismissals.">granted a motion to dismiss the federal securities fraud class action that had been filed against it shortly after releasing its Q1 guidance. No payments were made to any plaintiffs in connection with any of these dismissals.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • NSPH

    Shares of Nanosphere (NSPH +4.5%) trade higher today after being upgraded by Piper Jaffray to...

    Shares of Nanosphere (NSPH +4.5%) trade higher today after being upgraded by Piper Jaffray to Overweight this morning. The firm says that there has been meaningful activity since the company's Gram Positive test was approved. The firm also raises its price target to $4 from $2. Additionally, it's worth noting that there's been some significant insider buying in the shares recently.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • CMI

    Investors are undaunted by the 7% drop in Q2 earnings at Cummins (CMI +6%) just weeks after the...

    Investors are undaunted by the 7% drop in Q2 earnings at Cummins (CMI +6%) just weeks after the cut to its full-year revenue outlook. S&P Capital IQ added $0.25 to CMI's 2012 profit target, saying that, "despite lower revenues, CMI did a good job improving gross margins on price improvement, mix and manufacturing efficiencies," and should see strength "when revenue trends improve."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • CAS

    A.M. Castle (CAS -14.3%) plunges to its lowest level since 2009 after the specialty metal and...

    A.M. Castle (CAS -14.3%) plunges to its lowest level since 2009 after the specialty metal and plastics distributor posted Q2 numbers well below expectations. It also warned of a similar performance for the current quarter, given "customers' cautious outlook for the balance of 2012 and assuming no further softening of demand."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • DNB

    Shares of Dun & Bradstreet (DNB +15.7%) soar after reports filter in tipping off that the...

    Shares of Dun & Bradstreet (DNB +15.7%) soar after reports filter in tipping off that the company approached a group of banks to explore selling itself.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • WTI

    W&T Offshore (WTI +14.4%) could spend up to $3B on acquisitions by the end of the year...

    W&T Offshore (WTI +14.4%) could spend up to $3B on acquisitions by the end of the year as it is seeing many more assets up for sale than usual, CEO Tracy Krohn says a day after the oil and natural gas producer posted a higher-than-expected Q2 profit on lower costs. WTI says its revolving bank credit facility of $650M is largely undrawn and can be used for acquisitions.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • XPER

    On a good day for chip stocks, Tessera (TSRA -4.1%) is selling off on a downgrade to...

    On a good day for chip stocks, Tessera (TSRA -4.1%) is selling off on a downgrade to Underperform from BofA. The chip packaging technology developer barely moved last week after providing a strong Q2 report, but stating on its earnings call it will stop providing guidance as of Q1 2013 due to uncertainty surrounding its new camera module business.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • HUM

    Shares of Humana (HUM -13%) get slammed this morning, a day after the managed-care provider...

    Shares of Humana (HUM -13%) get slammed this morning, a day after the managed-care provider missed the mark on Q2 earnings and cut its profit outlook for the year. The dismal report is taking down more than one insurer that otherwise might have had an up day: Aetna (AET -1.9%), WellPoint (WLP -3.5%), UnitedHealth (UNH -3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 3 Comments
  • LOGM

    LogMeIn (LOGM -22%) crashes to new 52-week lows after a U.S. appeals court reverses a summary...

    LogMeIn (LOGM -22%) crashes to new 52-week lows after a U.S. appeals court reverses a summary judgment clearing the company of a patent infringement claim brought by private 01 Communique. The case has been remanded trial in a district court. LogMeIn fell hard last week due to the disappointing guidance accompanying its Q2 report. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • CSCO

    BroadSoft (BSFT +7.8%) after Goldman's Simona Jankowski upgrades to Buy. Jankowski forecasts...

    BroadSoft (BSFT +7.8%) after Goldman's Simona Jankowski upgrades to Buy. Jankowski forecasts 20%+ annual growth over the next 3 years, thanks to the ongoing adoption of the hosted VoIP/unified communications solutions BroadSoft's software enables. She also sees BroadSoft, with its reliance on maintenance revenue and user demand rather than carrier capex, as a defensive play in the current macro environment.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • CRY

    CryoLife (CRY +8.8%) a tissue processing and medical device company, pops after blowing away its...

    CryoLife (CRY +8.8%) a tissue processing and medical device company, pops after blowing away its Q2 earnings estimates and raising its FY12 guidance. The company sees fiscal year revenues of $129M to $133M, versus analysts estimates of $132M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM
  • RSH

    Shares of RadioShack (RSH +9.0%) run higher after SEC filings disclose another round of insider...

    Shares of RadioShack (RSH +9.0%) run higher after SEC filings disclose another round of insider buying.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 3 Comments
  • ALLT

    Allot (ALLT -5.7%) slumps following its Q2 report. Though results beat estimates, the provider...

    Allot (ALLT -5.7%) slumps following its Q2 report. Though results beat estimates, the provider of deep packet inspection gear expressed worries on its earnings call about the impact of weak European demand - the continent accounted for 40% of sales in Q2, down from Q1's 73%. Allot also announced the acquisition of Oversi Networks, a provider of content delivery network hardware for service providers (previous), for up to $21M. Oversi is expected to contribute $2M in quarterly revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • FSLR

    More on the solar industry: Trina's warning and Suntech's fraud disclosure come as signs of ugly...

    More on the solar industry: Trina's warning and Suntech's fraud disclosure come as signs of ugly industry demand and pricing continue to pile up. The price of solar cells with a 17% conversion efficiency has fallen 6% just over the last week, to $0.42/watt. "Poor order controls" and a "sudden demand freeze" are blamed for the drop. Last week, it was reported Chinese firms are selling idle equipment in order to raise cash. Industry giant First Solar (FSLR +5.3%) is rallying ahead of tomorrow's Q2 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM

  • Stocks turn south at lunchtime, the DJIA -0.4%, S&P 500 -0.3%, the Nasdaq -0.1%. A nice...

    Stocks turn south at lunchtime, the DJIA -0.4%, S&P 500 -0.3%, the Nasdaq -0.1%. A nice summary of an excuse to sell from JPMorgan's markets desk: "Spain capital outflows, Germany pours cold water on ESM, no Fed action, and expectations too high for ECB." (via Bryan Mortenson)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • TSL

    Trina Solar (TSL -9.3%) makes new lows after warning it expects Q2 module shipments of...

    Trina Solar (TSL -9.3%) makes new lows after warning it expects Q2 module shipments of 390MW-420MW, below prior guidance of 500MW-520MW. Trina also expects to report a gross margin of just 7%-9% (still better than LDK Solar's negative margin), a $26M-$28M inventory write-down, a $45M-$48M receivables provision (many solar vendors have had collection issues), and a forex loss of $22M-$23M. Shares could also be affected by Suntech's problems.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • SVU

    Shares of Supervalu (SVU +7.1%) spring higher again following its CEO swap. Wall Street analysts...

    Shares of Supervalu (SVU +7.1%) spring higher again following its CEO swap. Wall Street analysts widely back the new change based on the impressive performance of Wayne Sales when he was an exec at Canadian Tire.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • ACTG

    Patent pit bull Acacia Research (ACTG -14.3%) takes a hit today after announcing that its...

    Patent pit bull Acacia Research (ACTG -14.3%) takes a hit today after announcing that its Program Rewards Solutions subsidiary has entered into a settlement agreement with Citigroup. Details of the settlement are forthcoming, but the gist of the agreement resolves litigation that was pending in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • MU

    Micron (MU +4.4%) jumps following a report Elpida, which Micron is set to buy, along with JV...

    Micron (MU +4.4%) jumps following a report Elpida, which Micron is set to buy, along with JV Rexchip, has begun cutting DRAM output. A major Elpida plant is expected to see a 30% production cut, mostly focused on the commodity (i.e. PC) DRAM chips that were subject to intense price declines last year. The plant is, however, seeing huge orders from Apple for higher-margin mobile DRAM chips. The DRAM industry overall is expected to see a 10% drop in supply. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • ARR

    ARMOUR Residential (ARR -2.1%) gets hit with a huge sell order (check out the volume here)....

    ARMOUR Residential (ARR -2.1%) gets hit with a huge sell order (check out the volume here). Fresh off a July 9 secondary (it's 3rd in 8 months!), the stock has flown right past that decline to new 52-week highs. Look for another "huge" secondary, says Dividend Master, estimating the stock trades at a 14% premium to book value. Shares +9% YTD with a 15.6% annualized dividend.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 17 Comments
  • MHRCQ

    Magnum Hunter (MHR +2%) achieves a record average production rate of 12,893 boe/day during Q2,...

    Magnum Hunter (MHR +2%) achieves a record average production rate of 12,893 boe/day during Q2, up 161% Y/Y, boosted by acquisitions in the Williston basin in North Dakota and improved results from the Eagle Ford shale in south Texas. While production grew only 2% Q/Q, MHR touts its success in changing its production mix to ~50% oil and liquids.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • BP

    While it's tempting to discard BP's (BP -4.2%) $4.8B in Q2 writedowns as one-time costs,...

    While it's tempting to discard BP's (BP -4.2%) $4.8B in Q2 writedowns as one-time costs, analysts say it’s a troubling figure. "Writedowns were more than anticipated, and [with the] combination of weak operations, shares are reflecting that today," an Edward Jones analyst says, also noting that BP reported a 7% drop in production, worse than its major competitors.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -4.9%) tumbles to new lows; shares are now down 42% from their $38 IPO price. The...

    Facebook (FB -4.9%) tumbles to new lows; shares are now down 42% from their $38 IPO price. The decline comes after Bernstein's Carlos Kirjner provides a lukewarm upgrade to Market Perform. Kirjner values Facebook's ad business at $19/share, and everything else at a mere $4/share. Moreover, he's worried about a decline in European ad rates (ed: ad rates rose elsewhere), and a share lock-up expiration that begins in August, and will increase Facebook's float by 276% by November. ZNGA -2.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 12 Comments
  • SLCA

    U.S. Silica's (SLCA +4.4%) Q2 results beat expectations, boosted by demand for proppants used by...

    U.S. Silica's (SLCA +4.4%) Q2 results beat expectations, boosted by demand for proppants used by the oil and gas industry in hydraulic fracturing, but cuts the top end of its full-year revenue outlook by $5M; it now expects revenue of $395M-$415M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL +2.6%) rallies following Cirrus Logic's guidance; shares are now above where they...

    Apple (AAPL +2.6%) rallies following Cirrus Logic's guidance; shares are now above where they traded prior to the FQ3 miss. Apple could also be getting a lift from a Bernstein report claiming the company may be considering a stock split in order to get included in the price-weighted Dow. Meanwhile, sometimes-accurate Digitimes is reporting that suppliers of the in-cell touch panels to be used in the next iPhone are struggling with yield issues, and that Apple is providing subsidies in response.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 4 Comments
  • STP

    Suntech (STP -15.7%) crashes again following the company's admission that collateral promised to...

    Suntech (STP -15.7%) crashes again following the company's admission that collateral promised to it for guaranteeing a $662M investment may not exist. Worsening matters if the fact the investment firm promising the collateral was managed by a former Suntech sales rep. Class-action suits are already underway, and the fiasco is prompting new questions about the governance standards of Chinese ADRs. YGE -10.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM | 1 Comment
  • EMN

    Eastman Chemical (EMN +2.4%) is forming a JV with Sinopec (NYSE:SNP) to build a new resin plant...

    Eastman Chemical (EMN +2.4%) is forming a JV with Sinopec (NYSE:SNP) to build a new resin plant in China. The facility will boost EMN's total capacity for hydrogenated resins by 50%, which the company says will make it the biggest global supplier of hydrogenated hydrocarbon resins. The resins are useful in making packaging and personal hygiene products.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • JCP

    Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP +2.6%) track back from negative territory as CEO Ron Johnson takes to...

    Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP +2.6%) track back from negative territory as CEO Ron Johnson takes to the CNBC airwaves to explain away the new store concept that launches this week. The quick take: Stores will be lean and stylish replete with iPad integration, but will even more longtime J.C. Penney shoppers feel alienated?
